title: Difference political parties and interest groups

content.question:
A major difference between political parties and
 interest groups is that

choices.label:
interest groups typically shift their positions
 on issues over time, while political parties
 tend to keep the same position on issues
 over time

interest groups usually recruit candidates
 for office, while political parties usually
 limit themselves to making campaign
 contributions to candidates

political parties seek to gain control of
 government, while interest groups seek
 to influence public policy

political parties tend to have narrow
 coalitions of support, and interest groups
 tend to have broad coalitions of support

political parties usually focus on one issue,
 while interest groups focus mainly on many
 issues

content.answer:
political parties seek to gain control of
 government, while interest groups seek
 to influence public policy
